Articles.Content:
> ... going through 100 Kerbals would be far less expensive than having a roster with a hundred active ones.

I love how you encourage Kerbal sacrifice. :-)

> 
> He means removing elements from the demo, just like the 0.18.3 demo didn't have all the features of the 0.18.x release ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Ok, thanks for clearing that up! and I agree with those that say that the current demo is a bit...dated! Though I have a strong connection to the current one as that is what sealed the deal for me finally buying this on Steam! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The FOV thing will be great for viewing large stations.

And people having been asking for trackIR-type things for IVA view for a while now, so that's good too.

It's good that you're working on a new demo, too. Demos are what gets people to buy games. Books have blurbs, movies have trailers, games have demos.

> 
> This cost increases based on your current active crew count. That means, for instance, that going through 100 Kerbals would be far less expensive than having a roster with a hundred active ones.

Frankly, that makes no sense. So, I've killed my first 100 guys, and I can then hire 101th for a dime?

> 
> And lastly, this is something that IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m still working on today, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m adding a camera wobble system, to allow cameras to shake and vibrate in response to external forces. Currently I already have implemented effects when pulling high Gs, when rolling over the ground, and when intense aerodynamic effects are acting on the vessel. there are still a few other causes which I hope to implement, but even now this system already promises to be a significant enhancement to how flying feels.

I certainly hope that it would be toggleable. Because I don't want this Hollywoody-type thing (and I'm sure many would agree with me).

> 
> There might not even be one and that makes me sad in the heart.

And makes me crying in joy, because 99.9% of April Fools jokes are just plain stupid things done by some kids who just came out of diapers.

I've been staring at screens too long. I missed the "no" in your post.

Even though it's not logical I agree with the gameplay consequences of the "hire an astronaut" cost.

New players will kill more Kerbals, and making hiring more prohibitively expensive would just hurt them without actually adding challenge to experienced players.

Experienced players will want to hire more Kerbals, and (if my experience is typical) will also have millions of Kerbucks sitting around doing nothing, so this would actually give us some reason to keep going.
Would it be possible to have a toggle between the increasing upfront costs for hiring as described and salaries, so that hiring costs don't change but Kerbalnauts need regular paying?
